summary.span: 表示十进制浮点数。

span.span: Represents a decimal floating-point number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值类型表示介于正 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 和负 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 之间的十进制数字。The value type represents decimal numbers ranging from positive 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 to negative 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335. `Decimal` 的默认值为 0。The default value of a `Decimal` is 0. 值类型适用于需要大量重要整数和小数位且不舍入错误的财务计算。The value type is appropriate for financial calculations that require large numbers of significant integral and fractional digits and no round-off errors. 类型仍需要舍入，但它最大限度地减少了因舍入而导致的错误。The type does not eliminate the need for rounding. 相反，它最大限度地减少了因舍入而导致的错误。Rather, it minimizes errors due to rounding. 例如，下面的代码生成 0.9999999999999999999999999999 的结果，而不是 1。For example, the following code produces a result of 0.9999999999999999999999999999 instead of 1. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#1)] 当除法和乘法的结果传递到 方法时，结果将不会产生精度损失，如以下代码所示。When the result of the division and multiplication is passed to the method, the result suffers no loss of precision, as the following code shows. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#2)] 小数是一个浮点值，其中包含一个符号、一个数字值，其中的每个数字的范围为0到9，而缩放因子指示将整数和小数部分分隔的浮点小数点的位置。数值。A decimal number is a floating-point value that consists of a sign, a numeric value where each digit in the value ranges from 0 to 9, and a scaling factor that indicates the position of a floating decimal point that separates the integral and fractional parts of the numeric value. 值的二进制表示形式由1位符号、96位整数和比例因子组成，用于划分96位整数，并指定它的哪一部分是小数部分。The binary representation of a value consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the 96-bit integer and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 缩放系数隐式为数字10，指数范围为0到28。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 因此， 值的二进制表示形式（（-296到 296）/10（0到28）），其中-（296-1）等于 ，296-1 等于 。Therefore, the binary representation of a value the form, ((-296 to 296) / 10(0 to 28)), where -(296-1) is equal to , and 296-1 is equal to . 有关 值和示例的二进制表示形式的详细信息，请参阅 构造函数和 方法。For more information about the binary representation of values and an example, see the constructor and the method. 缩放系数还保留 数字中的任何尾随零。The scaling factor also preserves any trailing zeros in a number. 尾随零不会影响算术或比较运算中 数的值。Trailing zeros do not affect the value of a number in arithmetic or comparison operations. 但是，如果应用了适当的格式字符串，则 方法可能会显示尾随零。However, trailing zeros might be revealed by the method if an appropriate format string is applied. ## 转换注意事项Conversion Considerations 此类型提供了一些方法，这些方法可将 值与 、、、、、、和 值相互转换。This type provides methods that convert values to and from , , , , , , , and values. 从这些整型类型到 的转换是不会丢失信息或引发异常的扩大转换。Conversions from these integral types to are widening conversions that never lose information or throw exceptions. 从 到任何整型类型的转换是收缩转换，它将 值舍入为最接近的整数值。Conversions from to any of the integral types are narrowing conversions that round the value to the nearest integer value toward zero. 某些语言（如C#）还支持将 值转换为 值。Some languages, such as C#, also support the conversion of values to values. 如果无法在目标类型中表示这些转换的结果，则会引发 异常。If the result of these conversions cannot be represented in the destination type, an exception is thrown. 类型还提供了一些方法，这些方法可将 值与 和 值相互转换。The type also provides methods that convert values to and from and values. 从 到 或 的转换是收缩转换，这些转换可能会丢失精度，而不是有关转换后的值的量的信息。Conversions from to or are narrowing conversions that might lose precision but not information about the magnitude of the converted value. 转换不会引发异常。The conversion does not throw an exception. 如果转换结果不能表示为 ，则从 或 到 的转换将引发 异常。Conversions from or to throw an exception if the result of the conversion cannot be represented as a . ## 对十进制值执行运算Performing Operations on Decimal Values 类型支持标准数学运算，如加法、减法、除法、乘法和一元求反。The type supports standard mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, and unary negation. 还可以通过调用 方法，直接使用 值的二进制表示形式。You can also work directly with the binary representation of a value by calling the method. 若要比较两个 值，可以使用标准数值比较运算符，也可以调用 或 方法。To compare two values, you can use the standard numeric comparison operators, or you can call the or method. 您还可以调用 类的成员来执行各种数值运算，包括获取数字的绝对值、确定两个 值的最大值或最小值、获取数字的符号以及对数字进行舍入。You can also call the members of the class to perform a wide range of numeric operations, including getting the absolute value of a number, determining the maximum or minimum value of two values, getting the sign of a number, and rounding a number. ## Examples 以下代码示例演示了 的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of . remarks.format: ## Remarks 数字的二进制表示形式由1位符号、96位整数和比例因子组成，用于划分整数号，并指定它的哪一部分是小数部分。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 缩放系数隐式为数字10，指数范围为0到28。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. `bits` 是由四个元素组成的长度为32位的有符号整数的数组。`bits` is a four-element long array of 32-bit signed integers. `bits` [0]、`bits` [1] 和 `bits` [2] 包含96位整数的低、中和高32位。`bits` [0], `bits` [1], and `bits` [2] contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. `bits` [3] 包含缩放系数和符号，由以下部分组成：`bits` [3] contains the scale factor and sign, and consists of following parts: 位0到15是未使用的，并且必须为零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 位16到23必须包含一个介于0到28之间的指数，该指数指示10的幂来除以整数。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 不使用 Bits 24 到30，并且必须为零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 位31包含符号;0表示正，1表示负。Bit 31 contains the sign; 0 meaning positive, and 1 meaning negative. 一个数值可能有几个可能的二进制表示形式;都是相同的有效和数值等效的。A numeric value might have several possible binary representations; all are equally valid and numerically equivalent. 请注意，位表示形式区分负数和正零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 在所有操作中，这些值被视为相等。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用构造函数重载创建了多个 `Decimal` 数字，该重载使用一个包含四个 值的数组来初始化 `Decimal` 结构。The following code example creates several `Decimal` numbers using the constructor overload that initializes a `Decimal` structure with an array of four values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 数字的二进制表示形式由1位符号、96位整数和比例因子组成，用于划分整数号，并指定它的哪一部分是小数部分。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 缩放系数隐式为数字10，指数范围为0到28。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 返回值是一个四元素数组，其中包含32位有符号整数。The return value is a four-element array of 32-bit signed integers. 返回数组的第一个、第二个和第三个元素包含96位整数的低、中和高32位。The first, second, and third elements of the returned array contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. 返回数组的第四个元素包含刻度因子和符号。The fourth element of the returned array contains the scale factor and sign. 它由以下部分组成：It consists of the following parts: 位0到15是未使用的，并且必须为零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 位16到23必须包含一个介于0到28之间的指数，该指数指示10的幂来除以整数。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 不使用 Bits 24 到30，并且必须为零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 第31位包含符号：0表示正，1表示负。Bit 31 contains the sign: 0 mean positive, and 1 means negative. 请注意，位表示形式区分负数和正零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 在所有操作中，这些值被视为相等。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 `GetBits` 方法将若干 `Decimal` 值转换为其等效的二进制表示形式。The following example uses the `GetBits` method to convert several `Decimal` values to their equivalent binary representations. 然后，它显示 方法返回的数组中的元素的十进制值和十六进制值。It then displays the decimal values and the hexadecimal value of the elements in the array returned by the method. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/CPP/getbits.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/CS/getbits.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/VB/getbits.vb#2)] 下面的示例使用 方法检索数组的组件部分。The following example uses the method to retrieve the component parts of an array. 然后，在调用 构造函数时使用此数组来实例化新的 值。It then uses this array in the call to the constructor to instantiate a new value. |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选的符号。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|区域性特定的千位分隔符。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|区域性特定的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*小数位数**fractional-digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 使用 样式解释参数 `s`。Parameter `s` is interpreted using the style. 这意味着允许使用空格和千位分隔符，但不允许货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要显式定义可出现在 `s`中的元素（如货币符号、千位分隔符和空格），请使用 或 方法。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use either the or the method. 参数 `s` 使用为当前系统区域性初始化的 中的格式设置信息进行分析。Parameter `s` is parsed using the formatting information in a initialized for the current system culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅 。For more information, see . 若要使用其他某个区域性的格式设置信息分析字符串，请使用 或 方法。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other culture, use the or method. 如有必要，使用舍入到最接近的值舍入 `s` 的值。If necessary, the value of `s` is rounded using rounding to nearest. 的精度为29位。A has 29 digits of precision. 如果 `s` 表示一个数字超过29个数字，但包含小数部分并且在 和 范围内，则使用舍入到最接近的数字将该数字舍入，而不是截断到29位数。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在分析操作期间，在 `s` 参数中遇到分隔符，并且适用的货币或小数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作将假定分隔符是小数点分隔符，而不是组分隔符。If during a parse operation a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必须是 枚举中的位标志的组合。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 以下 成员不受支持：The following members are not supported: - - 根据 `style`的值，`s` 参数可能包括以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws][ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则空格可以出现在 `s` 的开头，如果 `style` 包含 标志，则它可以出现在 `s` 的末尾。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|区域性特定的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 其在字符串中的位置由当前区域性的 和 属性定义。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the current culture. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，当前区域性的货币符号可以出现在 `s` 中。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选的符号。An optional sign. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则符号会出现在 `s` 的开头，如果 `style` 包含 标志，则它可以出现在 `s` 的末尾处。The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则可以在 `s` 中使用括号来表示负值。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|区域性特定的千位分隔符。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，当前区域性的千位分隔符可以出现在 `s` 中。The current culture's thousands separator can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*.**.*|区域性特定的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，当前区域性的小数点符号会出现在 `s` 中。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*小数位数**fractional-digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 仅当 `style` 包含 标志时，小数位才能出现在 `s` 中。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |*e**e*|"E" 或 "E" 字符，指示值以指数表示法表示。The 'e' or 'E' character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential notation. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则 `s` 参数可以表示指数表示法中的数字。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| > [!NOTE] > 无论 `style` 参数的值是什么，分析操作都将忽略 `s` 中任何终止的 NUL （U + 0000）字符。Any terminating NUL (U+0000) characters in `s` are ignored by the parsing operation, regardless of the value of the `style` argument. 只有数字（对应于 样式）的字符串在 类型的范围内时才会成功进行分析。A string with digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully if it is in the range of the type. 其余 成员控制可能但不要求出现在输入字符串中的元素。The remaining members control elements that may be but are not required to be present in the input string. 下表指示单个 成员如何影响可能出现在 `s`中的元素。The following table indicates how individual members affect the elements that may be E\*\*位*的值;若要成功地分析具有正数或负号和小数点符号等元素的字符串，需要其他标志。This flag supports values in the form *digits*E*digits*; additional flags are needed to successfully parse strings with elements such as positive or `ws`, `sign`, `,` and `.` elements.| ||除 `s` 之外的所有样式不能表示十六进制数。All styles, except `s` cannot represent a hexadecimal number.| 使用为当前系统区域性初始化的 对象中的格式设置信息对 `s` 参数进行分析。The `s` parameter is parsed using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current system culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅 。For more information, see . 的精度为29位。A has 29 digits of precision. 如果 `s` 表示一个数字超过29个数字，但包含小数部分并且在 和 remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法的此重载通常用于将可通过多种方式设置格式的文本转换为 值。This overload of the method is commonly used to convert text that can be formatted in a variety of ways to a value. 例如，它可用于将用户输入的文本转换为一个数字值。For example, it can be used to convert the text entered by a user into an HTML text box to a numeric value. `s` 参数包含如下格式：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选的符号。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|区域性特定的千位分隔符。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|区域性特定的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*小数位数**fractional-digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 使用 样式对 `s` 参数进行解释。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the style. 这意味着允许使用空格和千位分隔符，但不允许货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要显式定义可出现在 `s`中的元素（如货币符号、千位分隔符和空格），请使用 方法。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method. `provider` 参数是一个 实现，如 或 对象。The `provider` parameter is an implementation, such as a or object. `provider` 参数提供用于分析的特定于区域性的信息。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in parsing. 如果 `provider` 为 `null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. 对象的精度为29位。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果 `s` 表示一个数字超过29个数字，但包含小数部分并且在 和 范围内，则使用舍入到最接近的数字将该数字舍入，而不是截断到29位数。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在执行分析操作期间在 `s` 参数中遇到了分隔符，并且适用的货币或小数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作将假定分隔符是小数点分隔符，而不是组分隔符。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅 、、和 。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例是 Web 窗体的按钮单击事件处理程序。The following example is the button click event handler of a Web form. 它使用 属性返回的数组来确定用户的区域设置。It uses the array returned by the property to determine the user's locale. 然后，它将实例化与该区域设置相对应的 对象。It then instantiates a object that corresponds to that locale. 然后，将属于该 对象的 对象传递到 方法，以将用户的输入转换为 值。The object that belongs to that object is then passed to the method to convert the user's input to a value. remarks.format: ## Remarks `style` 参数定义允许的 `s` 参数格式，以便分析操作成功。The `style` parameter defines the allowable format of the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必须是 枚举中的位标志的组合。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 以下 成员不受支持：The following members are not supported: - - 根据 `style`的值，`s` 参数可能包括以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws][ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*$*|区域性特定的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 其在字符串中的位置由 `provider` 参数的 方法返回的 对象的 和 属性定义。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the object returned by the method of the `provider` parameter. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，货币符号可以出现在 `s` 中。The currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则空格可以出现在 `s` 的开头，如果 `style` 包含 标志，则它可以出现在 `s` 的末尾。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选的符号。An optional sign. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则符号会出现在 `s` 的开头，如果 `style` 包含 标志，则它可以出现在 `s` 的末尾处。The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则可以在 `s` 中使用括号来表示负值。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|区域性特定的千位分隔符。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol. 如果 `style` 包括 标志，则 `provider` 定义的区域性的千位分隔符可以出现在 `s` 中。The thousands separator of the culture defined by `provider` can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*.**.*|区域性特定的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 如果 `style` 包括 标志，则 `provider` 定义的区域性的小数点符号可以出现在 `s` 中。The decimal point symbol of the culture defined by `provider` can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*小数位数**fractional-digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 仅当 `style` 包含 标志时，小数位才能出现在 `s` 中。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |*e**e*|"E" 或 "E" 字符，指示值以指数表示法表示。The 'e' or 'E' character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential notation. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则 `s` 参数可以表示指数表示法中的数字。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| > [!NOTE] > 无论 `style` 参数的值是什么，分析操作都将忽略 `s` 中任何终止的 NUL （U + 0000）字符。Any terminating NUL (U+0000) characters in `s` are ignored by the parsing operation, regardless of the value of the `style` argument. 只有数字（对应于 样式）的字符串在 类型的范围内时才会成功进行分析。A string with digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully if it is in the range of the type. 其余 成员控制可能但不要求出现在输入字符串中的元素。The remaining members control elements that may be but are not required to be present in the input string. 下表指示单个 成员如何影响可能出现在 `s`中的元素。The following table indicates how individual members affect the elements that may be present in `s`. |NumberStyles 值NumberStyles value|除数字外允许在 s 中使用的元素Elements permitted in s in addition to digits| |------------------------|---------------------------------------------------| ||仅限*数字*元素。The *digits* element only.| ||*.*The *.* 和*小数位数*元素。and *fractional-digits* elements.| ||`s` 参数还可以使用指数表示法。The `s` parameter can also use exponential notation. 此标志支持格式*为 E\*\*位*的值;若要成功地分析具有正数或负号和小数点符号等元素的字符串，需要其他标志。This flag supports values in the form *digits*E*digits*; additional flags are needed to successfully parse strings with elements such as positive or negative signs and decimal point symbols.| ||`s`开头的*ws*元素。The *ws* element at the beginning of `s`.| ||`s`末尾的*ws*元素。The *ws* element at the end of `s`.| ||`s`开头的*sign*元素。The *sign* element at the beginning of `s`.| ||`s`末尾的*sign*元素。The *sign* element at the end of `s`.| ||用括号括起数值的*符号*元素。The *sign* element in the form of parentheses enclosing the numeric value.| ||*，* 元素。The *,* element.| ||*$* 元素。The *$* element.| ||“全部”。All. `s` 参数不能表示十六进制数或以指数表示法表示的数字。The `s` parameter cannot represent a hexadecimal number or a number in exponential notation.| ||位于 `s`开头或结尾处的*ws*元素，在 `s`的开头处进行*签名*，并且为 *。*The *ws* element at the beginning or end of `s`, *sign* at the beginning of `s`, and the *.* 符号开头。symbol. `s` 参数还可以使用指数表示法。The `s` parameter can also use exponential notation.| ||`ws`*，`sign`、、* 和 *。*The `ws`, `sign`, *,*, and *.* 位置。elements.| ||除 `s` 之外的所有样式不能表示十六进制数。All styles, except `s` cannot represent a hexadecimal number.| `provider` 参数是一个 实现，如 或 对象。The `provider` parameter is an implementation, such as a or object. `provider` 参数提供用于分析的特定于区域性的信息。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in parsing. 如果 `provider` 为 `null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. 对象的精度为29位。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果 `s` 表示一个数字超过29个数字，但包含小数部分并且在 和 范围内，则使用舍入到最接近的数字将该数字舍入，而不是截断到29位数。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在执行分析操作期间在 `s` 参数中遇到了分隔符，并且适用的货币或小数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作将假定分隔符是小数点分隔符，而不是组分隔符。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅 、、和 。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例使用各种 `style` 和 `provider` 参数来分析 值的字符串表示形式。The following example uses a variety of `style` and `provider` parameters to parse the string representations of values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的行为遵循 IEEE 标准754第4部分。The behavior of this method follows IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 这种类型的舍入有时称为 "*整半角"，甚至*称为 "*银行家舍入*"。This kind of rounding is sometimes called *round half to even* or *banker's rounding*. 它最大程度地减少了通过以单方向持续舍入点值而导致的舍入误差。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. 它等效于使用 的 `mode` 参数调用 方法。It is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of . ## Examples 下面的示例将介于100和102之间的 值的范围舍入到最接近的整数。The following example rounds a range of values between 100 and 102 to the nearest integer. 由于方法使用的是 "中舍入"，因此请注意，100.5 舍入为100，101.5 舍入到102。Because the method uses banker's rounding, note that 100.5 rounds to 100 and 101.5 rounds to 102. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法等效于使用 的 `mode` 参数调用 方法。当 `d` 正好处于两个舍入值的正中间值时，结果是在最右小数点位置有偶数位的舍入值。This method is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of .When `d` is exactly halfway between two rounded values, the result is the rounded value that has an even digit in the far right decimal position. 例如，当舍入为两位小数时，值 2.345 变成 2.34，而值 2.355 变成 2.36。For example, when rounded to two decimals, the value 2.345 becomes 2.34 and the value 2.355 becomes 2.36. 此过程称为*甚至舍\*\*入的舍入*。This process is known as *rounding toward even*, or *banker's rounding*. 它最大程度地减少了通过以单方向持续舍入点值而导致的舍入误差。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 `Round` 方法将几个 `Decimal` 值舍入到指定的小数位数。The following example rounds several `Decimal` values to a specified number of decimal places using the `Round` method. [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Round#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Decimal.Round/cs/Round12.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Round#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Decimal.Round/vb/Round12.vb#12)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在中点值中，结果中的最小有效位后的值在两个数字之间精确到了一半。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 例如，如果要将舍入为整数，7.5 是中值。For example, 7.5 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 对于中点值，不能轻松地识别最接近的值，因为它是由 `mode` 参数指定的。For midpoint values, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支持两个用于处理中点值的舍入约定。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 远离零的舍入。Rounding away from zero. 中值舍入到下一个数字，而不是零。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 例如，3.5 舍入为4，4.5 舍入为5，-3.5 舍入到-4，-4.5 舍入到-5。For example, 3.5 rounds to 4, 4.5 rounds to 5, -3.5 rounds to -4, and -4.5 rounds to -5. 这种形式的舍入由 枚举成员表示。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 远离零的舍入是最广泛的舍入形式。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 舍入为偶数或按下舍入Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中值舍入为最接近的偶数。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，3.5 和4.5 舍入为4，-3.5 和-4.5 舍入到-4。For example, both 3.5 and 4.5 round to 4, and both -3.5 and -4.5 round to -4. 这种形式的舍入由 枚举成员表示。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 舍入到最接近的是在财务和统计操作中使用的标准舍入形式。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 它符合 IEEE Standard 754，第4部分。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 当在多个舍入操作中使用时，它可减少因按单一方向持续舍入点值而导致的舍入误差。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情况下，此舍入误差很重要。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下面的示例显示 方法返回的值、带有 `mode` 参数的 方法，以及 参数为 `mode` 的 方法。The following example displays values returned by the method, the method with a `mode` argument of , and the method with a `mode` argument of . remarks.format: ## Remarks `decimals` 参数指定返回值中的有效小数位数，范围为0到28。The `decimals` parameter specifies the number of significant decimal places in the return value and ranges from 0 to 28. 如果 `decimals` 为零，则返回整数。If `decimals` is zero, an integer is returned. 在中点值中，结果中的最小有效位后的值在两个数字之间精确到了一半。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 例如，如果要将两个小数位舍入，3.47500 是中值，如果要将它舍入到整数，则7.500 为中点值。For example, 3.47500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded two decimal places, and 7.500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 在这些情况下，如果没有舍入约定，则不能轻松地识别最接近的值，这是由 `mode` 参数指定的。In these cases, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支持两个用于处理中点值的舍入约定。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 远离零的舍入。Rounding away from zero. 中值舍入到下一个数字，而不是零。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 例如，3.75 舍入为3.8，3.85 舍入到3.9，-3.75 舍入到-3.8，-3.85 舍入到-3.9。For example, 3.75 rounds to 3.8, 3.85 rounds to 3.9, -3.75 rounds to -3.8, and -3.85 rounds to -3.9. 这种形式的舍入由 枚举成员表示。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 远离零的舍入是最广泛的舍入形式。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 舍入为偶数或按下舍入Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中值舍入为最接近的偶数。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，3.75 和3.85 舍入为3.8，-3.75 和-3.85 舍入到-3.8。For example, both 3.75 and 3.85 round to 3.8, and both -3.75 and -3.85 round to -3.8. 这种形式的舍入由 枚举成员表示。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 舍入到最接近的是在财务和统计操作中使用的标准舍入形式。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 它符合 IEEE Standard 754，第4部分。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 当在多个舍入操作中使用时，它可减少因按单一方向持续舍入点值而导致的舍入误差。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情况下，此舍入误差很重要。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何将 方法与 枚举一起使用。The following example demonstrates how to use the method with the enumeration. [!code-cpp[math.midpointrounding#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/math.midpointrounding/cpp/mpr.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[math.midpointrounding#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/math.midpointrounding/CS/mpr.cs#1)] [!code-vb[math.midpointrounding#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/math.midpointrounding/VB/mpr.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用当前区域性的默认值（"G" 或 "常规"）格式设置 值的格式。The method formats a value in the default ("G", or general) format of the current culture. 如果要指定其他格式或区域性，请使用 方法的其他重载，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |使用格式To use format|对于区域性For culture|使用重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值（"G"）格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定格式A specific format|默认（当前）区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下格式设置主题更详细地介绍了这些支持：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例使用默认的 方法显示 值。The following example displays a value using the default method. 它还显示了使用一些标准格式说明符生成的 值的字符串表示形式。It also displays the string representations of the value that result from using a number of standard format specifiers. [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.ToString#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.ToString/CS/ToString2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.ToString#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.ToString/VB/ToString2.vb#2)] 下面的示例显示帐户中的资金量。The following example displays the amount of money in an account. 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `provider` 参数是其 方法返回 对象的 实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object. 通常，`provider` 是 对象或 对象。Typically, `provider` is a object or a object. `provider` 参数提供用于设置格式的区域性特定信息。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in formatting. 如果 `provider` 为 `null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. 若要使用指定的区域性和特定格式字符串将 值转换为其字符串表示形式，请调用 方法。To convert a value to its string representation using a specified culture and a specific format string, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例使用表示多个不同区域性的 对象显示 值的字符串表示形式。The following example displays the string representation of a value using objects that represent several different cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使用当前区域性的约定来设置指定格式的 值的格式。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果要使用默认格式（"G" 或 "常规"）或指定不同的区域性，请使用 方法的其他重载，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |使用格式To use format|对于区域性For culture|使用重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值（"G"）格式Default ("G") format|默认（当前）区域性Default (current) culture|| |默认值（"G"）格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| 方法使用 `format` 参数指定的标准或自定义数字格式字符串将当前实例的值转换为其字符串表示形式。The method uses the standard or custom numeric format string specified by the `format` parameter to convert the value of the current instance into its string representation. `format` 参数可以是任何有效的[标准数值格式说明符](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，D、R 和 X 除外，还可以是[自定义数字格式说明符](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)的任意组合。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric format specifier](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) except for D, R, and X, as well as any combination of [custom numeric format specifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果 `format` `null` 或空字符串，则此实例的返回值将使用通用数值格式说明符（G）进行格式设置。If `format` is `null` or an empty string, the return value of this instance is formatted with the general numeric format specifier (G). .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下格式设置主题更详细地介绍了这些支持：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 使用当前区域性的 对象设置返回值的格式。The return value is formatted by using the object for the current culture. 若要应用指定区域性的格式设置约定，请调用 方法。To apply the formatting conventions of a specified culture, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例使用每个受支持的标准数值格式说明符和两个自定义数字格式字符串来显示 值。The following example displays a value using each of the supported standard numeric format specifiers, together with two custom numeric format strings. 将数值转换为字符串时，此示例使用 en-us 区域性的格式设置约定。In converting the numeric values to strings, the example uses the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载与 方法的不同之处在于，返回一个布尔值，该值指示分析操作是否成功，而不是返回已分析的数值。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 当 `s` 无效且无法成功分析时，无需使用异常处理来测试 。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. 参数 `s` 包含如下格式：Parameter `s` contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选的符号。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*，**,*|区域性特定的千位分隔符。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|区域性特定的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*小数位数**fractional-digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 使用 样式解释参数 `s`。Parameter `s` is interpreted using the style. 这意味着允许使用空格和千位分隔符，但不允许货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要显式定义可出现在 `s`中的元素（如货币符号、千位分隔符和空格），请使用 方法重载。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method overload. 参数 `s` 使用为当前系统区域性初始化的 对象中的格式设置信息进行分析。Parameter `s` is parsed using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current system culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅 。For more information, see . 若要使用某些其他指定的区域性的格式设置信息分析字符串，请使用 方法重载。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other specified culture, use the method overload. 如有必要，使用舍入到最接近的值舍入 `s` 的值。If necessary, the value of `s` is rounded using rounding to nearest. 对象的精度为29位。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果 `s` 表示一个数字超过29个数字，但包含小数部分并且在 和 范围内，则使用舍入到最接近的数字将该数字舍入，而不是截断到29位数。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在分析操作期间，在 `s` 参数中遇到分隔符，并且适用的货币或小数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作将假定分隔符是小数点分隔符，而不是组分隔符。If during a parse operation a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅 、、和 。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将数值的字符串表示形式转换为 值。The following example uses the method to convert the string representations of numeric values to values. 它假定 en-us 为当前区域性。It assumes that en-US is the current culture. [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.TryParse/cs/TryParse.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.TryParse/vb/TryParse.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载与 方法的不同之处在于，返回一个布尔值，该值指示分析操作是否成功，而不是返回已分析的数值。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 当 `s` 无效且无法成功分析时，无需使用异常处理来测试 。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `style` 参数定义允许的 `s` 参数格式，以便分析操作成功。The `style` parameter defines the allowable format of the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必须是 枚举中的位标志的组合。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 以下 成员不受支持：The following members are not supported: - - 根据 style 的值，`s` 参数可能包含以下元素：Depending on the value of style, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws][ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|说明Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选空白。Optional white space. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则 `s` 的开头可能会出现空白。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，则它可能会出现在 `s` 末尾。It can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|区域性特定的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 其在字符串中的位置由 `provider` 参数的 方法返回的 对象的 或 属性定义。Its position in the string is defined by the or properties of the object returned by the method of the `provider` parameter. 如果 `style` 包含 标志，货币符号可以出现在 `s` 中。The currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选的符号。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*.**.*|区域性特定的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*小数位数**fractional-digits*|介于0到9之间的一系列数字。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `style` 参数指定 `s` 参数的允许格式，可以是使用按位 "或" 运算组合在一起的一个或多个 枚举常数。The `style` parameter specifies the permitted format of the `s` parameter, and can be one or more enumerated constants combined using a bitwise OR operation. 如果 `style` 为 null，则使用 样式来解释 `s`。If `style` is null, `s` is interpreted using the style. `provider` 参数是一个 实现，如 或 对象。The `provider` parameter is an implementation such as a or object. `provider` 参数提供用于分析的特定于区域性的信息。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in parsing. 如果 `provider` 为 `null`，则使用当前区域性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. 对象的精度为29位。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果 `s` 表示一个数字超过29个数字，但包含小数部分并且在 和 范围内，则使用舍入到最接近的数字将该数字舍入，而不是截断到29位数。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在执行分析操作期间在 `s` 参数中遇到了分隔符，并且适用的货币或小数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作将假定分隔符是小数点分隔符，而不是组分隔符。If a separator is
